rl.sqltrainer.application

Class SQLTrainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • rl.sqltrainer.application.SQLTrainer

  • public class SQLTrainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade, hiding domain layer details from the GUI layer. The complete application can (and should) be controlled by an instance of this class.
    Author:
    Ruediger Lunde

      Feedback provideFeedback(int exerciseIdx)
      Executes the answer of the specified exercise (an SQL statement) on the database server and also the solution of the specified exercise and asks the used feedback strategy for a feedback.

    • Method Detail

      • getDBConnectionData

        public java.lang.String[] getDBConnectionData()
        Returns four strings: server name, database name, user name, and password.

      • getLogicalDBNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLogicalDBNames()
        Returns the logical names of all databases known by the SQLTrainer.

      • setDB

        public boolean setDB(java.lang.String logicalName)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the the specified database as current database, updates connection data if necessary and returns true if the new database differs from the previous selection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public void updateCurrExercise(java.lang.String answer,

        Replaces the maintained answer and solution texts for the current exercise if the new values differ to the old ones.
        Parameters:
        answer - Possibly null.
        solution - Possibly null.

      • executeStatement

        public void executeStatement(java.lang.String statement)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Executes the given SQL statement on the database server and updates the result table data.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • getResultTableData

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getResultTableData()
        Returns a list of lists of values. The first list contains the column names, all other lists contain rows with data set values. The list of lists can be empty!

      • clearTableData

        public void clearTableData()
        Removes all data from the result table.

      • provideFeedback

        public Feedback provideFeedback()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                EncryptionException
        Creates a feedback for the current exercise or for the whole exercise set if currExerciseIdx is -1.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        EncryptionException

      • provideFeedback

        public Feedback provideFeedback(int exerciseIdx)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                EncryptionException
        Executes the answer of the specified exercise (an SQL statement) on the database server and also the solution of the specified exercise and asks the used feedback strategy for a feedback.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        EncryptionException
